alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Pickens; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 06 at 2:19PM CDT until August 06 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN TUSCALOOSA...NORTHERN PICKENS AND FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 218 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fayette to near Ashcraft Corner to near Reform, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Fayette, Gordo, Reform, Carrollton, Berry, Belk, Bankston, Bull City, Samantha, Lake Lurleen State Park, Ashcraft Corner, Boley Springs, Bankhead Lock And Dam, Binion Creek Landing, Stone Wall, Whitson, Lake Tuscaloosa, Moores Bridge, Richard Arthur Field and Windham Springs. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage, including numerous trees down across the warned counties from Emergency Management. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
